entries.title: Alaska Native community relocates as climate crisis ravages homes
entries.description: The town of Newtok is one of the first communities in the US to collectively move because of the climate crisis.

entries.title: US House approves referendum on Puerto Rico’s future
entries.description: Bill, unlikely to pass in the Senate, would offer Puerto Rico voters choice between statehood and forms of independence.

entries.title: US lawmakers mull restrictions on TikTok over security concerns
entries.description: US lawmakers have voiced concern that user data could be accessed by the Chinese government.

entries.title: US jury convicts Texas police officer in fatal home shooting
entries.description: A jury found Aaron Dean guilty of manslaughter in the death of Atatiana Jefferson, killed during a police welfare check.

entries.title: Photos: Bethlehem welcomes Christmas tourists after pandemic lull
entries.description: Although tourism hasn't fully recovered, the hordes of visitors are an encouraging sign, business owners say.

entries.title: Slovakia’s government loses parliamentary no-confidence vote
entries.description: Fall of coalition government is latest stage of ongoing political crisis and could pave way for early elections.

entries.title: Ukrainian general says Russia preparing for ‘prolonged’ war
entries.description: Comments come as Russia pounded Kherson city and Kharkiv, while Ukraine shelled Donetsk in the east.

entries.title: Photos: Judge to rule on Castillo’s detention amid Peru protests
entries.description: Demonstrations held in support of ousted president across the country as his successor, Dina Boluarte, pleads for calm.

entries.title: Biden backs African Union becoming permanent G20 member
entries.description: US also pledges $165m to help support elections and good governance as African nations prepare to hold votes next year.

entries.title: UK launches probe into claims its troops killed Afghan civilians
entries.description: The independent probe will look into allegations that British special forces killed dozens of Afghan civilians.

entries.title: In a first, US watchdog gets full access to audit Chinese firms
entries.description: It marks a victory for US regulators and a relief for Chinese firms like Alibaba that faced delisting from US exchanges.

entries.title: What impact does China’s economy have on the rest of the world?
entries.description: Latest economic data from China paints a gloomier picture than analysts had forecast.

entries.title: Air pollution blights India’s capital
entries.description: A toxic haze hangs heavily over north India each year as winter sets in, affecting the health of millions of people.

entries.title: Thousands protest against conviction of Istanbul Mayor Imamoglu
entries.description: Supporters of Ekrem Imamoglu rally in Istanbul after a court sentenced the mayor to prison and banned him from politics.

entries.title: India test-fires Agni-V missile amid border tensions with China
entries.description: The nuclear-capable missile, with a range of 5,400km (3,300 miles) fired from Odisha state, a government minister says.

entries.title: Three US men sentenced for plan to kidnap Michigan governor
entries.description: Two ringleaders in the alleged kidnapping plot are also expected to receive sentences before the end of the month.

entries.title: ICC upholds sentence of Uganda child soldier turned LRA commander
entries.description: Judges ruled that Ongwen was not under duress and acted independently at the time when he had committed the crimes.

entries.title: US sees biggest drop in retail sales in 11 months
entries.description: Drop indicates higher borrowing costs and the threat of an imminent recession were starting to impact spending.

entries.title: There’s a mega climate problem with our megacities | All Hail
entries.description: Greening our cities makes them more liveable and more sustainable, but is this coming at too high a cost for some?

entries.title: Boris Becker departs for Germany after UK prison term
entries.description: The 55-year-old German six-time Grand Slam champion has served a prison sentence linked to his 2017 bankruptcy.

entries.title: Civilians wounded as fighting erupts at Pakistan-Afghan border
entries.description: At least 16 Pakistanis injured in Chaman, medical official says, as border forces clash for second time in a week.

entries.title: MPs seek answers from UK gov’t about Rapid Action Battalion trips
entries.description: Call for 'clear answers' comes after Al Jazeera revealed notorious Bangladeshi unit travelled to UK for spy training.

entries.title: Julius Hirsch: The German ‘national hero’ killed by the Nazis
entries.description: Only the second Jew to play for Germany, Hirsch broke records and fought in WWI for a country that would kill him.

entries.title: Bank of England hikes interest rate to 14-year high
entries.description: The central bank's interest rate hike to 3.5 percent, the ninth rise in a row, aims to cool sky-high inflation.

entries.title: Middle East round-up: Public hanging in Iran seen as message
entries.description: Here’s a round-up of Al Jazeera’s Middle East coverage this week.

entries.title: Why is Africa turning away from the United States?
entries.description: Former African Union diplomat Arikana Chihombori-Quao doesn’t see much hope for this week's US-Africa Leaders Summit.

entries.title: Tensions in north Kosovo – whose agenda does the flare-up serve?
entries.description: Ethnic fractures in the Western Balkans, including in Kosovo's Serb-populated area, create trouble for the EU and US.

entries.title: El Arena: The Middle East’s underground battle rap competition
entries.description: As Beirut plunges into crisis, battle rappers from across the Arab world fight to keep their battle rap league alive.

entries.title: Mbappe tells Hakimi: ‘You made history’ at the World Cup
entries.description: After France dashed Morocco's hopes in Wednesday's semifinal, the friends swapped shirts, hugs and respect.

entries.title: Southeast Asia’s Female Fighters
entries.description: 101 East investigates the rise of female fighters in armed groups across Southeast Asia.

entries.title: Up to 100,000 nurses stage ‘last resort’ strike in UK over pay
entries.description: The Royal College of Nursing members' walkout is part of a growing wave of stoppages by public and private sector staff.

entries.title: Ex-Tunisian president warns of ‘Arab volcano’ ahead of elections
entries.description: Former Tunisian President Moncef Marzouki tells Al Jazeera current President Kais Saied is part of 'counter-revolution'.

entries.title: What can the Patriot missile do for Ukraine?
entries.description: US has agreed to send a Patriot missile battery to Ukraine, but experts say it may not be a game changer in the war.

entries.title: Ebola vaccines produced lasting antibodies during trial: Studies
entries.description: Studies in West Africa said the vaccines developed by Johnson & Johnson and Merck & Co appear to be safe in children.

entries.title: At least 31 dead in India’s Bihar after drinking toxic alcohol
entries.description: Deaths happened mainly in two villages in impoverished state, where sale and consumption of liquor were banned in 2016.

entries.title: At least three people killed in Louisiana as winter storm hits US
entries.description: A mother and her eight-year-old child killed in US state of Louisiana and several others injured amid heavy storms.

entries.title: WHO chief says uncle was ‘murdered’ by Eritrean troops in Tigray
entries.description: Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus is a former Ethiopian minister from Tigray who has been a vocal critic of the conflict.

entries.title: Irish soldier killed after UN convoy attacked in Lebanon
entries.description: The Irish soldier was serving on a peacekeeping mission when the convoy came under small arms fire.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 295
entries.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 295th day, we take a look at the main developments.

entries.title: China’s retail, factory output slump as COVID curbs hit growth
entries.description: Factory output and retail sales missed forecasts in November amid lockdowns and weakening global demand.

entries.title: Dozens freed in new Ukraine-Russia prisoner swap
entries.description: Latest exchange suggests some contact remains between two sides despite intense fighting in Ukraine's east and south.

entries.title: Australia accuses Apple, Microsoft of overlooking child sex abuse
entries.description: Internet safety watchdog says tech giants should automatically scan for child exploitation material on their services.

entries.title: Fiji’s opposition to challenge election results
entries.description: Move comes after Fiji authorities took down a provisional tally that showed the opposition holding a very early lead.

entries.title: Taiwanese train for war after year of crises
entries.description: As tensions rise in the Taiwan Strait, private companies are stepping forward to prepare Taiwanese civilians for war.

entries.title: United Nations blocks Myanmar military taking UN seat
entries.description: Rights groups say the National Unity Government, made up of elected members, must represent Myanmar at all UN bodies.
